intro: Dregea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dregea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in suitable climates.
